Blanche II of Navarre (1424-1464). Engraving. Colored

Blanche II of Navarre (1424-1464). Queen of Navarre. Blanche of Navarre is delivered to the Captal of Buch, who orders imprison her into a castle. Engraving after a painting by Eduardo Rosales. Colored

Mary Evans Picture Library makes available wonderful images created for people to enjoy over the centuries

Media ID 14331343

Â© Thaliastock / Mary Evans

Bearn Blanche Buch Castile Confinement Count Delivered Eduardo Eleanor Feudal Foix Gaston Husband Imprisonment Infante Navarra Navarre Nobleman Rosales Sister Evreux Imprison Moncada Orthez

EDITORS COMMENTS

In this evocative engraving, we witness a pivotal moment in the life of Blanche II of Navarre (1424-1464), the Queen of Navarre. The image, created by Eduardo Rosales and colored, depicts the moment when Blanche is being delivered into the custody of the Captal of Buch, a nobleman from Foix, in the castle of Buch. The scene is set against the backdrop of the Middle Ages, an era marked by feudal loyalties and complex political alliances. Blanche is depicted as a regal figure, dressed in the finest medieval attire, with an air of determination and resilience in her eyes. Surrounding her are a group of men, including her husband, Gaston IV of Foix-Bearn, the Infante of Castile, Eleanor of Navarre, her sister, and other noblemen from Asturies, Evreux, Moncada, and Orthez. The interior of the castle tower looms ominously in the background, a symbol of Blanche's impending confinement and imprisonment. The Captal of Buch, a stern and imposing figure, stands before Blanche, his expression betraying a mixture of authority and concern. The scene is a testament to the complex web of power dynamics and political maneuverings that characterized the medieval world, where alliances could shift rapidly, and the fate of a queen could hang in the balance. This engraving is a stunning reminder of the intricacies of medieval politics and the strength and resilience of the women who navigated them. It is a powerful visual representation of Blanche II of Navarre's story, a tale of power, politics, and determination in the face of adversity.
